newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil Jan 21-Feb 20 IGP-M index rises 0.43 pct.
newsitem.headline: Brazil Jan 21-Feb 20 IGP-M index rises 0.43 pct.

text.p: Brazilian inflation between Jan 21 and Feb 20 slowed to 0.43 percent, against 1.77 percent between Dec 21 and Jan 20 as measured by the IGP-M index released by the Getulio Vargas Foundation (FGV).

The IGP-M is composed of three other economic indicators: the IPA wholesale price index, which rose 0.27 percent in the period, the IPC consumer price index, which advanced 0.73 percent in the period, and the INCC national index of construction costs, which gained 0.31 percent.
The IPA has a 60 percent weighting in the IGP-M, the IPC a 30 percent weighting and the INCC 10 percent, the FGV said.
The IGP-M index, which measures inflation over 10-day intervals, is published by the independent research institute Fundacao Getulio Vargas (FGV).
